items.sentence: How did you know Tom would be able to help us?
How did your plans to move to Boston work out?
How in the world do you expect me to pay this?
How late did you stay at the party last night?
The concert was short, but it was really good.
I\'m afraid that there isn\'t any coffee left.
I\'m afraid you\'re sitting in the wrong seat.
You\'re lying and you\'re not very good at it.
Tom doesn\'t look like he\'s enjoying himself.
Tom told me he wanted to visit Mary in Boston.
Tom told me he was going to clean up his room.
Tom told me he was hoping to get into Harvard.
Tom told me he was planning to move to Boston.
I have a feeling you\'re going to like Boston.
I never imagined I\'d feel this way about you.
Tom has been to your place before, hasn\'t he?
I want you to know that I\'ll do that for you.
Both my mother and father were born in Boston.
I think you\'ll be able to change Tom\'s mind.
You and Tom were happy together, weren\'t you?
You can\'t just stand there and watch Tom die.
We\'ve achieved a lot in the past three years.
We\'ve already spent too much time doing this.
We\'ve finally been given permission to leave.
We\'ve known each other for over thirty years.
Do I look like a guy who wants to get married?
I\'m likely going to find some way to do that.
I\'m just going to lie down for a few minutes.
How did Tom think he could get away with this?
According to Tom, Mary used to live in Boston.
Everyone except Tom and Mary are already here.
Have you ever thought about quitting your job?
We always look forward to Tom\'s annual visit.
I haven\'t yet bought you a Christmas present.
I know that you are learning French at school.
I managed to make myself understood in French.
I met him by chance on the train this morning.
I missed the opening ceremony of the Olympics.
I can\'t eat raw eggs. They have to be cooked.
Please don\'t interrupt me while I\'m talking.
Are you sure you don\'t want a glass of water?
I\'m not a coward, but I\'m not stupid either.
Everyone knows that we don\'t like each other.
For one thing, Tom doesn\'t know the language.
Tom said that he didn\'t want to eat anything.
Tom saw Mary, but didn\'t say anything to her.
Tom doesn\'t always go to bed before midnight.
Tom doesn\'t approve of that kind of language.
Tom doesn\'t care what happens to his old car.
Tom doesn\'t come here as often as he used to.
